title: Usage
description: Nuxt Custom-Elements is used to export components from a Nuxt.js project as custom elements, this is used when providing widgets.

children.value: Nuxt Custom-Elements is used to export components from a
project as custom elements, this is used when providing widgets.
These are the first steps you need to export a component built in
as a custom element. Alternatively, you can take a look at the
Create a component that you want to use as custom element.
modules in the custom elements. For using Vue plugins,
After the installation, add the module in the
Remember that the created component must be added to the module.
For providing a custom element an entry must be created, this needs a name and should be specified in
The previously created component is put under
. The name must also be specified as
If necessary you can also define multiple custom elements in
After the module is installed & configured, the generation of the custom element can be started.

Remember to ignore the specified tags with

in Vue. For the local Vue instance the respective tag is unknown.
::

props.code:
<script>

import Vue from 'vue';

Vue.config.ignoredElements = [
  'custom-element-example'
];

export default {
  created () {
    this.$customElements.registerEntry('Example')
  }
}
</script>

children.value: Place the relevant tags in a
tag, this is important so that the tag is not resolved in
The Webpack Public Path is important for the integration of a custom element entry on an external page.
It defines from which origin the resources (fonts, images, scripts) should be loaded.
Normally this Public Path is located at
, if I include an entry externally, all resources on the external page will be loaded.
To solve this, the build must be told what the correct Public Path is.
is included, so the public path must also be defined with this url as root.
The modification can be done in two ways:
Define fixed public path in the build
For a fixed definition of the publich path, the
option must be extended in the entry in
Alternatively, the public path can be set dynamically in the
You can use other plugins with Nuxt Custom-Elements.
you can find configurations for the examples.
